newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TENNIS-TOP SEED KAFELNIKOV OUT IN FIRST ROUND.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-TOP SEED KAFELNIKOV OUT IN FIRST ROUND.

text.p: Defending champion Yevgeny Kafelnikov was knocked out in the first round of the Australian hardcourt tennis championships by Sweden's Mikael Tillstrom on Monday.
The Russian top seed said after his 6-2 6-2 defeat he no longer aimed to oust Pete Sampras from the top of the world rankings.
"Number one in the world is not a goal anymore. If it comes, it comes, but I'm not going to put myself under pressure," he said.
Kafelnikov won more matches on the ATP tour in 1996 than any other player and has risen to number three in the world rankings.
He was the only player in the world top 20 to enter the hardcourt tournament at Memorial Drive, a warm-up event for the Australian Open, but was easily beaten by Tillstrom, ranked 47th in the world.
Kafelnikov, who won the French Open title this year, is among the favourites for the first grand slam of 1997, starting in Melbourne on January 13.

In other matches on Monday, Zimbabwe's Byron Black, runner-up to Kafelnikov at the last Australian hardcourt championships, defeated Denmark's Kenneth Carlsen 6-4 6-3 to set up a second round meeting with Tillstrom.
Russia's Andrei Cherkasov, given a wildcard entry after a request by Kafelnikov, vindicated his presence by knocking out seventh seed Renzo Furlan of Italy 4-6 6-4 6-4.
